result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Stanley R Kuhn was found guilty of OWI (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Prior to re-licensing the defendant is to complete an OWI Assessment.

miscConds.notes: Bond in the amount of $1250.00 to be applied. Balance of costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Defendant is ordered to participate and successfully complete the Waushara County TAD/Safe Streets Program.   Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.  Defendant may petition for early termination of probation term after completion of 18 months, provided request is joined by agent, all financial obligations are paid in full, graduation from Waushara County TAD, and all treatment programming is completed.

timeConds.notes: With Huber and Good Time Credit. Pursuant to s. 346.65(7), Wis. Stats., Defendant shall be required to remain in the County Jail for not less than a 48 consecutive hour period prior to release for huber.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 3:05 pm cases called-15CM392, 15FO266 & 15TR2617. Defendant Stanley R Kuhn in court with attorney Jared Redfield.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached on the record.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 1.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses outright Count 2 and dismisses and reads-in 15FO266 & 15TR2617. Statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: SWD and places on probation for a period of 2 years. CONDITIONS: The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. AODA and Follow through, Participate and successfully complete the Waushara County TAD program to graduation. 50 days WCJ, with Huber and Good Time Credit to begin forthwith. Credit for 1 days served. 48 hour rule. $1744.00 fine inclusive of costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Bond posted applied. 24 month DL revocation, 24 mo IID effective today, OWI Assessment. May petition for early termination of probation after 18 months with successful completion of TAD and recommendation of supervising agent. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 15, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

2:27 pm case called. Defendant Stanley R Kuhn in court with attorney Jared Redfield.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant wishes to apply to the TAD program.  ADA Anderson does not object to the adjournment.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 15, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-18-2016 02:30 pm

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.    No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

Case Called @ 3:43 PM: Defendant Stanley R Kuhn in court, appearing pro se.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wants counsel and intends to retain his own counsel.  Court will proceed with that expectation.  Court orders $1250 cash bond w/conditions.  ADA states for the record that DA did represent Def directly in the past approx 15 yrs.  Def has no objection to the ADA moving forward and negotiating a resolution.  NGP entered by the Court.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 03:15 pm.
